entry.et: Middle English valeye, from Anglo-French valee, from val valley vale

def.dt: :an elongate depression of the earth's surface usually between ranges of hills or mountains
:an area drained by a river and its tributaries
:the place of meeting of two slopes of a roof that form on the plan a reentrant angle

entry.et: from its prevalence in the San Joaquin valley of California

def.dt: :an adolescent girl from the San Fernando Valley
:one whose values, mannerisms, and especially speech patterns resemble those of such a girl
volcanic region SW Alaska in Katmai National Park
village SE New York on Long Island pop 36,368
:a low perennial herb (Convallaria majalis) of the lily family that has usually two large oblong lanceolate leaves and a raceme of fragrant nodding bell-shaped white flowers
:an elongated valley formed by the depression of a block of the earth's crust between two faults or groups of faults of approximately parallel orientation

:an acute usually epizootic mosquito-borne disease of domestic animals chiefly of eastern and southern Africa that is caused by a bunyavirus (species Rift valley fever virus of the genus Phlebovirus), is marked especially by fever, abortion, and death of newborns, and is sometimes transmitted to humans usually in a less severe form
town SE California N of San Bernardino pop 54,239
valley cen California comprising the valleys of the Sacramento & San Joaquin rivers
